coding_practice.title: Minimum Swaps To Make Sequences Increasing
coding_practice.description:
You are given two integer arrays of the same length nums1 and nums2. In one operation, you are allowed to swap nums1[i] with nums2[i].

For example, if nums1 = [1,2,3,8], and nums2 = [5,6,7,4], you can swap the element at i = 3 to obtain nums1 = [1,2,3,4] and nums2 = [5,6,7,8].
Return the minimum number of needed operations to make nums1 and nums2 strictly increasing. The test cases are generated so that the given input always makes it possible.

An array arr is strictly increasing if and only if arr[0] < arr[1] < arr[2] < ... < arr[arr.length - 1].

examples.explanation:
Swap nums1[3] and nums2[3]. Then the sequences are:
nums1 = [1, 3, 5, 7] and nums2 = [1, 2, 3, 4] which are both strictly increasing.

coding_practice.explanation:
1. 定義兩個數組 keep 與 swap，分別表示不交換和交換當前位置的最少操作數。
2. 初始化 keep[0] = 0, swap[0] = 1。
3. 遍歷每個位置 i，如果 A[i] > A[i-1] 且 B[i] > B[i-1]，則 keep[i] = keep[i-1]，swap[i] = swap[i-1] + 1。
4. 如果 A[i] > B[i-1] 且 B[i] > A[i-1]，則更新 keep[i] = min(keep[i], swap[i-1])，swap[i] = min(swap[i], keep[i-1] + 1)。
5. 返回 min(keep[-1], swap[-1]) 即為最少操作數。
